author: powerful_dragon_89378
content:
The thing is totally reproducible, basically it synch's for ca 5 minutes, after which it logs as follows.  After the 5 minutes it logs "Synchronization terminated". I can't see any logs of interest just all kinds of peers connected / rejected. But eth.synching just says false. The last non-false eth.synching output that I got was eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 107029,
  healedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  healedBytecodes: 0,
  healedTrienodeBytes: 0,
  healedTrienodes: 0,
  healingBytecode: 0,
  healingTrienodes: 0,
  highestBlock: 109528,
  startingBlock: 0,
  syncedAccountBytes: 0,
  syncedAccounts: 0,
  syncedBytecodeBytes: 0,
  syncedBytecodes: 0,
  syncedStorage: 0,
  syncedStorageBytes: 0
}

content: As far as I can tell, it never resumes synchronizing

author: seamonkey82
content:
Can't seem to get besu to peer.  With geth I use `--nat:extip` to advertise the correct IP.  It appears that `--p2p-host` in besu should accomplish the same thing.  Here's my full command line:
`./besu --data-path "/home/seamonkey/eth/kintsugi-lighthouse-besu" --genesis-file "/home/seamonkey/eth/kintsugi-lighthouse-besu/besu_genesis.json" --rpc-http-apis="ETH, NET, WEB3, DEBUG" --rpc-http-cors-origins="moz-extension://a0ffd254-28a5-4292-bf02-4195ced390d3,moz-extension://f6780ea6-1162-4fe5-b170-c37b605ae299" --network-id=1337702 --sync-mode=full --p2p-port 13453 --rpc-http-port 8548 --p2p-host "1.2.3.4" --rpc-http-enabled`
Also, I tried running with `--Xmerge-support=true`, but that yields `Unable to start mining without a coinbase`.  Something else I need to add/change?
